sen.j: 野村 利三郎（のむら りさぶろう、弘化元年（1844年） - 明治2年3月25日 (旧暦)（1869年5月6日））は、新選組隊士。
sen.e: Risaburo NOMURA (1844 - May 6, 1869) was a member of the Shinsengumi (a special force that guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate).
sen.cmt: 新選組→the Shinsengumi (a special force that guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate)としました。

sen.j: 美濃国旗本加藤平内領出身。
sen.e: He was from the estate of Heinai (平内) KATO, who was a hatamoto (direct retainer) of Mino Province.
sen.cmt: 加藤平内領→’平内’の正式な読み方が不明です：estate of Heinai (平内) KATO としました。

sen.j: 宗門人別から該当する人物は嘉市。
sen.e: He can be identified as a person called 'Kaichi' according to Shumon ninbetsu cho (a census register by religious sect).

sen.j: 入隊時期は不明だが、慶応4年（1868年）3月、五兵衛新田に屯集した新選組に野村の名前を見出すことが出来る。
sen.e: The time of his enrollment in the Shinsengumi is unknown, but in the record of the military buildup at Goheishinden district in March 1868 (表記の変更), Nomura' s name can be found.
sen.cmt: 屯集→定訳不明：military buildup としました。

sen.j: 翌4月、下総流山で新選組局長近藤勇が新政府軍へ出頭する際、付き添って共に新政府軍に捕縛された。
sen.e: In the next month, April, when Head of Shinsengumi, Isami Kondo presented himself at the station of the New government army in Nagareyama of Shimousa Province, he accompanied Kondo and was also captured.
sen.cmt: 新政府軍→station of the New government armyとしました。

sen.j: その後、同月25日に近藤は処刑され、野村も一緒に処刑されるはずだったが、近藤の助命嘆願により、同じく捕らえられていた相馬と共に釈放された。
sen.e: Afterwards, although Kondo was executed on May 17, 1868 (表記の変更), Nomura, who was also scheduled to be executed together with Kondo, was released with Soma, another captive, thanks to Kondo's pleading for their lives.

Afterwards, although Kondo was executed on May 17, 1868, Nomura, who was also scheduled to be executed together with Kondo, was released with Soma, another captive, thanks to Kondo's pleading for their lives.

sen.j: 釈放後は相馬主計と行動を共にして旧幕府軍陸軍隊隊長春日左衛門の下に付く。
sen.e: After he was released, he worked together with Kazue SOMA, under the direction of Saemon KASUGA, who was the commander of the former Edo bakufu's army forces (Edo bakufu was the last Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 奥羽越列藩同盟とともに常磐口で官軍と抗戦した。
sen.e: He fought against the government army at Jobanguchi, in tandem with the Oetsu-reppan alliance.

sen.j: 奥羽越列藩同盟壊滅後、仙台へ向かい、そのとき榎本武揚艦隊および土方歳三らと合流し、蝦夷地へ渡った。
sen.e: After the Oetsu-reppan alliance was abrogated, he went to Sendai and joined Takeaki ENOMOTO fleet, Toshizo HIJIKATA and others, and crossed the sea to Ezo (present Hokkaido).

sen.j: 野村は新選組に復帰せず、陸軍隊の一隊を任されていたが、隊長春日の統率姿勢に不満を持ち、命令違反などのトラブルを起こす。
sen.e: Nomura did not return to the fold of Shinsengumi, and although he was exclusively in charge of a squad of the army forces, he was not satisfied with the commander Kasuga's leadership and caused various troubles including disobedience to Kasuga's orders.
sen.cmt: 陸軍隊の一隊→one squad of the army forces としました。

sen.j: 蝦夷共和国成立後は、土方の直属である陸軍奉行添役に就任した。
sen.e: After the Ezo Republic was established as a republic, he held the post of Rikugun bugyo soeyaku (magistrate's assistant of the Edo bakufu's army forces), the post which was under Hijikata's direct control.

sen.j: 明治2年3月25日、宮古湾海戦の際、回天丸に乗船していた野村は、真っ先に東艦に斬り込んで行ったと言われている。
sen.e: It is said that during the Battle of Miyakowan Bay, Nomura was on the warship Kaitenmaru, and on May 6, 1869 (表記の変更), he took the initiative to cut into the enemy's warship positioned in the East.
sen.cmt: 回天丸→warship Kaitenmaruとしました。 東艦→定訳不明：enemy's warship positioned in the East としました。

sen.e: It is said that his squad was about to withdrew, but he was killed on the ironclad warship and his body was thrown away to the sea by the New government army.
